                    <span class='footnote'  title='Section 25 was substituted by section 2 of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >27</a></sup></span></span>[25. (1) All Fees referred to in section 3 or chargeable under this Act, shall be collected either by receipts or stamps or through electronically or digitally or, in case of scarcity of stamps or non- availability of electronic or digital means, in cash:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>Provided that fees chargeable for serving and executing processes issued by a Certificate-officer in the proceedings in execution of certificates filed for recovery of land revenue or rent may be collected in cash or through electronically or digitally.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>(2) The Government may, for the purpose of sub-section (1), appoint any Scheduled Bank, mobile operator, mobile phone based financial service (MFS), authority or agent, as it deems fit, to receive such fees.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>(3) When a Scheduled Bank, mobile operator, mobile phone based financial service (MFS), authority or agent receives fees through electronically or digitally, it shall grant a receipt or e-receipt accordingly.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Stamps to be impressed or adhesive

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    26. The stamps used to denote any fees chargeable under this Act shall be impressed or adhesive or partly impressed and partly adhesive, as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette from time to time direct.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Rules for supply, number, renewal and keeping accounts of stamps

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    27. The Government may, from time to time, make rules for regulatingï€­<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) 	the supply of stamps to be used under this Act,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b) 	the number of stamps to be used for denoting any fee chargeable under this Act,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c) 	the renewal of damaged or spoiled stamps, <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œandâ€ was omitted by section 3(a) of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >28</a></sup></span></span>[***] <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d) 	the keeping accounts of all stamps used under this Act<span class='footnote'  title='The comma (,) was substituted for the colon (:) and clause (e) and (f) were inserted by section 3(b) of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016). '><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >29</a></sup></span></span>[, <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>(e) the collection of fees through electronically or digitally, and<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>(f) the mode of refund of fees under section 37:]<div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that, in the case of stamps, used under section 3 in the High Court Division, such rules shall be made with the concurrence of the Chief Justice of  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œthe Supreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œsuch Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >30</a></sup></span></span>[the Supreme Court].<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>All such rules shall be published in the official Gazette and shall thereupon have the force of law.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Stamping documents inadvertently received

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	28. No document for which fee is payable under this Act shall be of any validity, unless and until it is properly stamped or supported by proper receipt. But, if any such document is through mistake or inadvertence received, filed or used in any court or office without being properly stamped or supported by proper receipt, the presiding judge or the Head of the office, as the case may be, or, in the case of the High Court Division, any Judge of such court, may, if he thinks fit, order that such document be stamped or supported by receipt as he may direct; and, on such document being stamped or supported by receipt accordingly the same and every proceeding relating thereto shall be as valid as if it had been properly stamped or supported by receipt in the first instance.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Amended document

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    29. Where any such document is amended in order merely to correct mistake and to make it conform to the original intention of the parties, it shall not be necessary to impose fresh stamp or receipt.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Cancellation of stamp

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    30. No document requiring a fee under this Act shall be filed or acted upon in any proceeding in any court or office until the stamp or the receipt has been cancelled.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Such Officer as the court or the head of the office may from time to time appoint shall, on receiving any such document, forthwith effect such cancellation by punching out  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œShaplaâ€ was replaced, for the words "the crescent and star" by the Bangladesh National Anthem, Flag and Emblem Order, 1972 (Presidentâ€™s Order No. 130 of 1972).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >31</a></sup></span></span>[Shapla] so as to leave the amount designated on the stamp untouched, and the part removed by punching shall be burnt or otherwise destroyed.The receipt filed along with any document shall be cancelled with the word "Cancelled" thereon under the signature of an officer in whose office it is filed:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that if any document bearing a Court-fee stamp of a design current in  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPakistan immediately before the twenty sixth day of March, 1971â€ were substituted, for the words â€œBritish India immediately before the fifteenth day of August, 1947â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >32</a></sup></span></span>[Pakistan immediately before the twenty sixth day of March, 1971], and still current in Bangladesh is presented to the proper officer, he shall forthwith effect the cancellation by punching out the figure-head so as to leave the amount designated untouched.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter VI

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                MISCELLANEOUS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    31. [Repealed by section 163 of the Code of Criminal Procedure Amendment Act 1923, (Act No. XVIII of 1923).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    32. [Repealed by the Amending Act 1891 (Act No. XII of 1891).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Administration in criminal cases of documents for which proper fee has not been paid

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    33. Whenever the filing or exhibition in a Criminal Court of a document in respect of which the proper fee has not been paid is, in the opinion of the presiding Judge, necessary to prevent a failure of justice, nothing contained in section 4 or section 6 shall be deemed to prohibit such filing or exhibition.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Sale of stamps

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    34.(1) The Government may, from time to time, make rules for regulating the sale of stamps or granting of receipts to be used under this Act, the person by whom alone such sale is to be conducted or grant is to be made, and the duties and remunerations of such persons.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) All such rules shall be published in the official Gazette, and shall thereupon have the force of law.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Any person, appointed to sell stamps or grant receipts, who disobeys any rule made under this section, and any person, not so appointed, who sells or offers for sale any stamp or grants or offers to grant any receipt, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, which may extend to <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œfifty thousandâ€ were substituted for the words â€œfive hundredâ€ by section 4 of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016). '><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >33</a></sup></span></span>[fifty thousand] taka, or with both.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Enlargement of time

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p><span class='footnote'  title='Section 34A was inserted by section 14 of the Court-fees (Amendment) Act, 1935 (Act VII of 1935).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >34</a></sup></span></span>[34A. Where any period is fixed or granted by the Court for the doing of any act prescribed or allowed by this Act, the Court</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>may, in its discretion, from time to time enlarge such period, even though the period originally fixed or granted may have expired.]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power to suspend, reduce or remit fees

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    35.(1) The Government may from time to time subject to such conditions or restrictions as it may think fit to impose, by notification in the official Gazette, suspend the payment of or reduce or remit, in the whole of  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œBangladeshâ€ was replaced for the words â€œEast Pakistanâ€ by Article 5 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (Presidentâ€™s Order No. 48 of 1972).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >35</a></sup></span></span>[Bangladesh] or in any part thereof, all or any of the fees mentioned in the first and 2nd schedules to this Act annexed and may in like manner cancel or vary such order.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The Government may, from time to time by rules prescribe the manner in which any fee the payment of which is suspended under sub-section (1) may be realized and for this purpose direct that such fee may be recovered as a public demand.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Variation of rates

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p><span class='footnote'  title='Sections 35A was inserted by section 4 of Ordinance, 1962 (Ordinance No. LII of 1962).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >36</a></sup></span></span>[35A.(1) The ad valorem fees leviable on the institution of suits specified in Schedule I [as amended before the promulga-tion of the Court-fees (Amendment) Ordinance, 1962, by any Central or Provincial Act] shall be reduced by fifteen per centum where the value of the subject-matter exceeds two thousand taka but does not exceed fifteen thousand taka and shall be increased by fifteen per centum where the value of the subject-matter exceeds fifteen thousand taka:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Provided that the proper Court-fee, where the value of the subject-matter exceeds two thousand taka but does not exceed two thousand four hundred taka, shall be two hundred eighty-one taka and twenty-five poisha.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) The amount of fee leviable after reduction of increase provided for in sub-section (1) shall be calculated to the nearest taka or half taka, whichever it may be.]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Saving of fees to certain officers of the High Court Division

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    36. Nothing in Chapters II and V of this Act applies to the fees which any officer of the High Court Division is allowed to receive in addition to a fixed salary.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             Mode of refund

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <span class='footnote'  title='Section 37 was added by section 5 of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >37</a></sup></span></span>[37. Fees refundable under this Act or any other law may be refunded through electronically or digitally.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

â€œSupreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œHigh Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>23</sup> </h6>The words â€œSupreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œHigh Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>24</sup> </h6>The words â€œSupreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œHigh Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>25</sup> </h6>The word â€œPresidentâ€ was substituted, for the words â€œProvincial Governmentâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>26</sup> </h6>The words and brackets â€œ(to consolidate and amend the Law relating to Courts of Small Causes beyond the local limits of the ordinary original Civil Jurisdiction of the High Courts of Judicature)â€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>27</sup> </h6>Section 25 was substituted by section 2 of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>28</sup> </h6>The word â€œandâ€ was omitted by section 3(a) of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>29</sup> </h6>The comma (,) was substituted for the colon (:) and clause (e) and (f) were inserted by section 3(b) of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016). </li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>30</sup> </h6>The words â€œthe Supreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œsuch Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>31</sup> </h6>The word â€œShaplaâ€ was replaced, for the words "the crescent and star" by the Bangladesh National Anthem, Flag and Emblem Order, 1972 (Presidentâ€™s Order No. 130 of 1972).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>32</sup> </h6>The words â€œPakistan immediately before the twenty sixth day of March, 1971â€ were substituted, for the words â€œBritish India immediately before the fifteenth day of August, 1947â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>33</sup> </h6>The words â€œfifty thousandâ€ were substituted for the words â€œfive hundredâ€ by section 4 of the Court Fees (Amendment) Act, 2016 (Act No. XIV of 2016). </li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>34</sup> </h6>Section 34A was inserted by section 14 of the Court-fees (Amendment) Act, 1935 (Act VII of 1935).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>35</sup> </h6>The word â€œBangladeshâ€ was replaced for the words â€œEast Pakistanâ€ by Article 5 of the <a title='Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 ' href='/act-388.html'>Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 </a>(Presidentâ€™s Order No. 48 of 1972).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6         $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

            });

        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® I

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                PRELIMINARY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Short title

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1. This Act may be called the <a title='Court-fees Act, 1870' href='/act-21.html'>Court-fees Act, 1870</a>.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Extent of Act

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    It extends to the whole of  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œBangladeshâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œPakistanâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[Bangladesh];

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Commencement of Act

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    And it shall come into force on the first day of April, 1870.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1A. [Omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a>(Act No.  VIII of 1973).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Definitions

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,ï€­<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1) 	"Appealâ€ includes a cross-objection;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) 	[Omitted by 1st Schedule of the East Pakistan Repealing and Amending Ordinance, 1962 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1962).]<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) "Collectorâ€ includes any officer not below the rank of Sub-Deputy Collector appointed by the Collector to perform the functions of a Collector under this Act; <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) "Suitâ€ includes an appeal from a decree except in section 8A.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® II

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                FEES PAYABLE IN COURTS AND IN PUBLIC OFFICES

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Levy of fees in the High Court Division on their original sides

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    3. The fees payable for the time being to the clerks and officers (other than the sheriffs and attorneys) of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œHigh Court Divisionâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œHigh Courtsâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >3</a></sup></span></span>[High Court Division];<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>or chargeable  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œin each of such Courtsâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >4</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] under No. 11 of the first, and Nos. 7, 12, 14, 20 and 21 of the Second Schedule to this Act annexed;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='The words and comma â€œand the fees for the time being charitable in the Courts of Small Causes at the Presidency-towns, and their several officesâ€ were omitted by the Schedule of the Adaptation of Central Acts and Ordinances Order, 1949.'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >5</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] shall be collected in manner hereinafter appearing.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Fees on documents filed, etc., in the High Court Division 	in their extraordinary jurisdiction;

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. No document of any of the kinds specified in the first or Second Schedule to this Act annexed, as chargeable with fees, shall be filed, exhibited or recorded in, or shall be received or furnished by, the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œHigh Court Divisionâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œHigh Courtsâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >6</a></sup></span></span>[High Court Division] in any case coming before such Court in the exercise of its extraordinary original civil jurisdiction; or in the exercise of its extra-ordinary original criminal jurisdiction;

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            in their appellate jurisdiction;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    or in the exercise of its jurisdiction as regards appeals from the judgments (other than judgments passed in the exercise of the ordinary original civil jurisdiction of the Court) of one or more judges of the said Court, or of a Division Court;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>or in the exercise of its jurisdiction as regards appeals from the Courts subject to its superintendence;

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            as Courts of reference and revision

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    or in the exercise of its jurisdiction as a Court of reference or revision;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	unless in respect of such document there be paid a fee of an amount not less than that indicated by either of the said Schedules as the proper fee for such document.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Procedure in case of difference as to necessity or amount of fee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. When any difference arises between the officer whose duty it is to see that any fee is paid under this chapter and any suitor or attorney, as to the necessity of paying a fee or the amount thereof, the question shall, when the difference arises in the High Court Division, be referred to the taxing-officer, whose decision thereon shall be final, except when the question is, in his opinion, one of general importance, in which case he shall refer it to the final decision of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œChief Justice of the Supreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œChief Justice of such High Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >7</a></sup></span></span>[Chief Justice of the Supreme Court], or of  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œsuch Judge of the Supreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œSuch Judge of the High Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >8</a></sup></span></span>[such Judge of the Supreme Court] as the Chief Justice shall appoint either generally or specially in this behalf.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>The Chief Justice shall declare who shall be taxing officer within the meaning of the first paragraph of this section.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Fees on documents filed, etc., in Mufassil Courts or in public offices

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. (1) Except in the Courts hereinbefore mentioned no document of any of the kinds specified as chargeable in the first or second schedule to this Act annexed shall be filed, exhibited or recorded in any Court of Justice, or shall be received or furnished by any public officer, unless in respect of such document there has been paid a fee of an amount not less than indicated by either of the said Schedules as the proper fee for such document.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1) or in any other Act, a Court may receive a plaint or memorandum<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>of appeal in respect of which an insufficient fee has been paid, subject to the condition that the plaint or memorandum of appeal shall be rejected unless the plaintiff or appellant, as the case may be, pays to the Court within a time to be fixed by the Court such reasonable sum on account of court-fees as the Court may direct.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® III

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                COMPUTATION OF FEES

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Computation of fees payable in certain suits

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    7. The amount of fee payable under this Act in the suits next hereinafter mentioned shall be computed as follows:-

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (i) for money;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>i. In suits for money (including suits for damages or compensation, or arrears of maintenance, of annuities, or of other sums payable periodically) -according to the amount claimed:</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (ii) for maintenance and annuities;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>ii. In suits for maintenance and annuities or other sums payable periodically-according to the value of the subject-matter of the suit, and such value shall be deemed to be ten times the amount claimed to be payable for one year:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Provided that, in suits by widows for maintenance such value shall be deemed to be the amount claimed to be payable for one year.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (iii) for moveable property having a market-value;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>iii. In suits for moveable property other than money, where the subject-matter has a market-value - according to such value at the date of presenting the plaint:</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (iv) (a) for moveable property of no market- value;(b) [Omitted](c) for declaratory decree and consequential relief;(d) for an injunction;(e) for easements;(f) for accounts;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>iv. In suits-</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(a) for moveable property where the subject-matter has no market-value, as, for instance, in the case of documents relating to title,</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(b) [Omitted by section 7(1) of the Court-fees (Amendment) Act, 1935 (Act No. VII of 1935).]</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(c) to obtain a declaratory decree or order, where consequential relief is prayed.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(d) to obtain an injunction.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(e) for a right to some benefit (not herein otherwise provided for ) to arise out of land, and</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(f) for accounts-</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>according to the amount at which the relief sought is valued in the plaint or memorandum of appeal subject to the provisions of section 8C.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p><span class='footnote'  title='The words, colon and full-stop â€œIn all such suits the plaintiff shall state the amount at which he values the relief sought: Provided that in such suits the valuation shall not be such as would attract a court-fee of less than one hundred taka.â€  were substituted,  for the words and full-stop â€œIn all such suits the plaintiff shall state the amount at which he values the relief sought.â€ by section 2 of the Finance Act, 1989 (Act No. XXXVI of 1989)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >9</a></sup></span></span>[In all such suits the plaintiff shall state the amount at which he values the relief sought:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Provided that in such suits the valuation shall not be such as would attract a court-fee of less than <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œtwo hundred takaâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œfive hundred takaâ€ by section 2 of the Court-Fees (Amendment) Act, 2002 (Act No. XXIV of 2002)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >10</a></sup></span></span>[two hundred taka].]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (v) 	for possession of land, buildings or gardens;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>v. In suits for the possession of land, buildings or gardensï€­</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(a) according to the value of the subject-matter, and such value shall be deemed to be fifteen times the net profit which have arisen from the land, building or garden during the years next before the date of presenting the plaint, or if the Court sees reason to think that such profit have been wrongly estimated, fifteen times such amount as the Court may assess as such profits or according to the market-value of the land, building or garden,</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>whichever is greater:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(b) if, in the opinion of the Court, such profits are not readily ascertainable or assessable, or where there are no such profits, according to the market-value of the land, building or garden:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Explanation.ï€­In this paragraph &ldquo;building&rdquo; includes a house, out-house, stable, privy, urinal, shed, hut, wall and any other such structure, whether of masonry, bricks, wood, mud, metal or any other material whatsoever:</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (vi) 	to enforce a right of pre-emption;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>vi. In suit to enforce a right of pre-emption-according to the market-value of the land, building or garden in respect of which the right is claimed:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p><span class='footnote'  title='The proviso and Explanation were substituted, for â€œExplanationâ€ by section 2 of the Finance Act, 1989 (Act No. XXXVI of 1989).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >11</a></sup></span></span>[Provided that in an application to enforce a right of pre-emption under section 96 of the <a title='State Acquisition and Tenancy Act, 1950 ' href='/act-241.html'>State Acquisition and Tenancy Act, 1950 </a>(E.B Act No. XXXVIII of 1951) or under section 24 of the <a title='Non-Agricultural Tenancy Act, 1949 ' href='/act-232.html'>Non-Agricultural Tenancy Act, 1949 </a>(E.B Act No XXIII of 1949), a fixed fee of an amount of <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œâ€two hundred takaâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œfive hundred takaâ€ by section 2 of the Court-Fees (Amendment) Act, 2002 (Act No. XXIV of 2002).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >12</a></sup></span></span>[two hundred taka] shall be payable.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Explanation.ï€­In this paragraph &quot;building&quot; has the same meaning as in paragraph v;]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>viA. In suits for partition and separate possession of a share of joint family property or of a joint property, or to enforce a right to a share in any property on the ground that it is joint family property or joint property-</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>if the plaintiff has been excluded from possession of the property of which he claims to be a co-parcener or co-owner, according to the market value of the share in respect of which the suit is instituted:</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (vii)	for interest of assignee of land revenue;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>vii. In suits for the interest of an assignee of land revenue - fifteen times his net profits as such for the years next before the date of presenting the plaint:</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (viii) 	to set aside an attachment;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>viii. In suits to set aside an attachment of land or of an interest in land or revenue - according to the amount for which the land or interest was attached:</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (viiiA)	to set aside decrees;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>viiiA. In suits to set aside decrees passed for ascertained amounts - according to the amounts of the decrees sought to be set aside, or where such decrees are not for any ascertained amounts, the fee payable shall be the same as paid on the plaints of the suits in which the questioned decrees were passed:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Provided that, where such amount exceeds the value of land or interest, the amount of fee shall be computed as if the suit were for the possession of such land or interest:</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            (ix) 	to redeem;	to foreclose;

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>ix.
